United Nations Press Releases of "Palestine," Address delivered at University of the State of New York 1949 June 11

Press conference on the Republic of Congo by Dr. Ralph Bunche at UN Headquarters on Thursday, 1 September 1960 1960 September 1

View image

Scope and Contents

Transcript for immediate release of a press conference held upon Bunche's return from the Republic of Congo. Attended by the international press. The first six pages are Dr. Bunche's statement followed by the questions from and answers to the press.

Letter, 1954 May 28, Washington D.C. to Secretary of State John Foster Dulles, Washington D.C. 1954 May 28

View image

Scope and Contents

Letter of clearance from the United States Civil Service Commission to the Secretary of State for transmission to the Secretary General of the United Nations, confirming Bunche's loyalty to the United States government.

Letter, 1954 July 1, New York, N.Y. to Dr. Ralph J. Bunche 1954 July 1

View image

Allegation 7, original correspondence and draft of reply (1 of 2) 1939-1954

Allegation 7, original correspondence and draft of reply (2 of 2) 1936-1954

Memorandum presenting suggestive notes on "the Negro worker and his struggles for economic justice," prepared for Miss Thompson, September 11, 1940 September 11, 1940

View image

Scope and Contents

Letter and memorandum addressed to Miss Thompson in response to her request on behalf of Mrs. Eleanor Roosevelt for information on the subject of Negro labor.

Page 1 is the cover letter of memorandum, addressed to Miss Malvina G. Thompson, The White House, Washington, D.C. from Ralph J. Bunche, Professor of Political Science.

Letter, 1945 April 19, the Secretary of State, Washington D.C. to Mr. Ralph Bunche, Acting Associate Chief, Division of Dependent Area Affairs 1945 April 19

View image

Letter, 1960 July 8, Leopoldville, Congo to Ralph Bunche, Jr. 1960 July 8

View image

Scope and Contents

Photocopy of letter sent from the Stanley Palace Hotel, Avenue Moulaert, Leopoldville. Bunche writes of the revolt and his concerns about the Congo and expresses his love for his family.

Letter, 1963 July 29, New York, N.Y. to Mr. Woody Klein, New York, N.Y. 1963 July 29

View image

Scope and Contents

Cover letter from Joan Klein, Ralph Bunche's secretary. Refers to Klein's notes (enclosed) on his interview with Bunche, which Bunche has edited.

Letter, 1963 November 20, to Mr. Jackie Robinson, Vice-president, Chock Full O'Nuts, New York, N.Y 1963 November 20

View image

Scope and Contents

Letter to Robinson regarding a column he wrote in the New York Amsterdam News supporting Bunche in the face of critical attacks by Malcolm X and Adam Powell.

Letter, 1965 March 6, Washington D.C. to Ralph J. Bunche, New York, N.Y. 1965 March 6

View image

Scope and Contents

Letter from Misses Allen and Cross, students at Howard University, inquiring about Bunche's participation in the civil rights movement. Holograph notes (draft reply) beginning on recto, continuing on verso. Formal reply on 10 March 1965: "Dear Miss Allen and Miss Cross..."

Letter, 1965 March 10, New York, N.Y. to Miss Margaret Allen and Miss Agnes Cross, Washington, D.C. 1965 March 10

Scope and Contents

Includes a few handwritten remarks at the bottom of the page.

Excerpts from telephone conversation between Mr. Bunche and Mr. Burglund of the West Side Tennis Club, 1959 July 6 / Ingrid Nagorski, transcriber 1959 July 6 1959 July 8

View image

Scope and Contents

The first three pages are the transcribed excerpts of the conversation between Burglund and Bunche regarding the denial of Ralph Bunche Jr.'s application for membership in the tennis club based on his race; p. 4 is a separate statement by Bunche regarding the issue.

Pocket Calendar and transcript 1960 July - August

Notebook, "Observations and Impressions, (Travel Diary of a Black American)" and notes 1932 July 13-18

Scope and Contents

Notes of Bunche's activities in Paris.

Notebooks, "First General Assembly Meeting (First half) London 1946," Books I, II, and III 1945 December 30 - February 16, 1946

Physical Description: 3 notebooks

Scope and Contents

Diaries recording Bunche's activities during the First General Assembly Meeting of the UN.

Notebook, Haiti trip 1953, December 29 - January 4, 1954

Scope and Contents

Brief notes on social activities in Haiti.

Notebook, South American trip 1955 February 10 - March 3

Scope and Contents

Journal from UN Survey Mission to Brazil, Argentina, Chile, Peru, Panama and Mexico.

Notes and notebooks, Gold Coast (Ghana) and Egypt trip 1957 March 2-April 10

Physical Description: 4 notebooks

Scope and Contents

Notebook I includes descriptions of Ghana's independence ceremonies. Notebooks II, III and IV describe Bunche's work with the United Nations Emergency Force (UNEF) and meetings with Egyptian President Gamal Abdel Nasser.
